block.p: George Zahringer III of Deepdale Golf Club in Manhasset, N.Y., a two-time champion in the Met Life/Met Golf Association Ike Tournament, shot a three-under-par 66 for the first-round lead in the event yesterday at the Nassau Country Club in Glen Cove, N.Y.

George Zahringer III of Deepdale Golf Club in Manhasset, N.Y., a two-time champion in the Met Life/Met Golf Association Ike Tournament, shot a three-under-par 66 for the first-round lead in the event yesterday at the Nassau Country Club in Glen Cove, N.Y.
The 47-year-old Zahringer, the winner in 1989 and 1993, held a three-stroke lead over Andy Svoboda, Jim Graham and Larry Hall in the stroke-play competition.

''I played in only five tournaments last year,'' Zahringer said, ''and I closed the season by winning the Nassau Invitational on this very same course. That gave me great psychological confidence for this year.''
A field of 98 started, and the cut was six-over 75, leaving 45 players remaining for today's final 36 holes. Par is normally 70, but it was dropped to 69 because of the recent heavy rains.

Ken Macdonald, the defending champion, registered a 70 along with his cousin Dan Macdonald and Mike Hyland. Ed Gibstein, who captured the Ike in 1994, is one of three players at 71. Jerry Courville Jr., a three-time winner, the last being in 1997, is at 72.
